DataElement.preferredName: Childhood Epilepsy Seizure Per Month Frequency Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Number to represent how many times per month a child experiences seizures.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The time period between the beginning of infancy and the end of adolescence._A brain disorder characterized by episodes of abnormally increased neuronal discharge resulting in transient episodes of sensory or motor neurological dysfunction, or psychic dysfunction. These episodes may or may not be associated with loss of consciousness or convulsions._A diagnosis made from a study of the signs and symptoms of a disease. (On-line Medical Dictionary)_Sudden, involuntary skeletal muscular contractions of cerebral or brain stem origin.--2004_Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The time period between the beginning of infancy and the end of adolescence.:A brain disorder characterized by episodes of abnormally increased neuronal discharge resulting in transient episodes of sensory or motor neurological dysfunction, or psychic dysfunction. These episodes may or may not be associated with loss of consciousness or convulsions.

Concepts.definition: A time period that begins at the beginning of the human embryonic stage and continues until the end of adolescence.

A brain disorder characterized by episodes of abnormally increased neuronal discharge resulting in transient episodes of sensory or motor neurological dysfunction, or psychic dysfunction. These episodes may or may not be associated with loss of consciousness or convulsions.

Property.preferredDefinition: Sudden, involuntary skeletal muscular contractions of cerebral or brain stem origin.--2004:Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

Concepts.definition: Sudden, involuntary skeletal muscular contractions of cerebral or brain stem origin.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Sudden, involuntary skeletal muscular contractions of cerebral or brain stem origin.--2004_For each, generally denoting a ratio._One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar.  It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks._The number of occurrences of something within a given time period. (NCI)_Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Sudden, involuntary skeletal muscular contractions of cerebral or brain stem origin.--2004:For each, generally denoting a ratio.:One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar.  It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.:The number of occurrences of something within a given time period. Concepts.definition: Sudden, involuntary skeletal muscular contractions of cerebral or brain stem origin.
For each, generally denoting a ratio.
One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.
The number of occurrences of something within a given time period.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
